restrictive.translation[0].definitions[0: something that is restrictive stops people doing what they want to do
Many members thought the rules were too restrictive.
a restrictive policy on admission to the college
restrictive.translation[1].definitions[0: greatly limiting or controlling what is allowed to happen
The rest of Europe kept interest rates high to match the Bundesbank’s restrictivemonetary policies.
Environmentalists have drafted another proposal that is far more restrictive than last year’s initiative.
restrictive.translation[1].definitions[1: an unfair action by a company, country etc that limits trade, competition etc
The U.S. suspects that the country’s restrictive trade practices are partly to blame for the rising trade deficit.
restrictive.translation[1].definitions[2: unreasonable limits that one TRADE UNION puts on the kind of work the members of other trade unions are allowed to do
The restrictive practices of stubborn unions kept the new printing presses idle.
